FuncDef:
The bind ap command binds a master's Remote-AP interface to an AP's AC interface.
The undo bind ap command unbinds a master's Remote-AP interface from an AP's AC interface.
By default, no Remote-AP interface is bound to an AP's AC interface.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the type and number of an AP's AC interface.
The specified type and number must be the same as those of the AC interface connected to the master.

Specifies the management IP address of an AP. A loopback interface address is used as the AP's management IP address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the name of an AP, which has been configured using the ap name command.
The value is a string of 1 to 63 characters, spaces not supported. The first character cannot be a digit or an underscore (_).
When quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After you create a Remote-AP interface on a master, run the bind ap interface command to bind the Remote-AP interface to an AP's AC interface to ensure that a VC can be established between the master and AP.
Prerequisites
A Remote-AP interface has been created using the interface remote-ap command.
